text: Thank you so much. It's so good to be here. Oh my gosh.

feedback.summary: Consider adding a stronger opening hook

details.message: Openings should ideally signal your comedic style or tone. Consider adding a quick, light joke or observational quip right after the greeting to grab attention.

text: Happy Virgo season. Yeah. That was a test. Now I know where my enemies are. Got your ass. Got your ass. I'm with you.

feedback.summary: Refine astrology reference for broader clarity

details.message: Clarify the 'test' and 'enemies' line — consider briefly explaining how recognizing Virgo season reveals your enemies to help land the joke.
You could tag this with a quick line about what kind of people fail that 'test' — e.g., overly rational types, Geminis, etc.

text: I've been dabbling in astrology a bit lately because I'm not well. And I am unfortunately a Gemini. Woo! Also known as a two-faced bitch, according to my birth chart and some other people.

feedback.summary: Solid premise, room to heighten the character self-roast

details.message: The line 'two-faced bitch' is funny — you might heighten the absurdity by giving a specific quote from your chart like 'will destroy friendships in June.'
Lean further into the dry self-deprecating tone — e.g., 'some other people… mostly my exes and my therapist.'

text: What I like about astrology is that it sort of lets you surrender to something bigger than yourself... Take it up with the sky.

feedback.summary: Great build with thematic callbacks — consider tightening

details.message: This segment runs a bit long. You could tighten the middle by trimming slightly repetitive lines like 'It's like religion in that way' if it doesn’t add punch.
‘Take it up with the sky’ is strong — consider calling back to it later in the set when referencing another personal flaw.

text: no I I like I I do like astrology I just think it's best paired with some therapy... I miss my dad.

feedback.summary: Strong cultural and character contrasts — consider polishing the ending tag

details.message: The 'I miss my dad' tag is funny and dark — consider preceding it with a slightly longer pause or setup to increase impact.
You could briefly mention how you reconciled therapy with your upbringing — this adds texture and another laugh from contrast.

text: I can't help but notice there's a lot of cuties here tonight... Gorgeous.

feedback.summary: Clever misdirection — clarify punchline setup slightly

details.message: The 'I'm bi... by myself' is clever. Consider adding a small setup before to prime the audience for a misdirect (e.g., 'So just a heads up...').
The 'decorated war heroes' line may be a slight non sequitur — consider clarifying the joke’s logic or connecting it more clearly to the previous line.

text: Yeah, I'm trying to get back out there... That's something just sort of unique and interesting about me.

feedback.summary: Punchline needs clearer sarcasm or misdirection

details.message: ‘Something unique about me’ undercuts the setup — clarify that the line is sarcastic, or twist it further to expose the banality.

text: I will say though, now that I'm leaving my apartment a lot more often... She's a Sag.

feedback.summary: Strong premise with clear escalation — consider tag enhancements

details.message: You could tag the 'before Christ door technology' with a quick historical misreference — e.g., 'Even Jesus had a ring camera.'
Consider calling back to Alexa’s priorities later in the set — e.g., 'Thanks to Alexa, I know my ex’s moon sign but not my landlord’s phone number.'

text: I have been celebrating the return of gossip... It's just a good journalist.

feedback.summary: Fantastic contrast between gossip and conspiracy — polish the closing beat

details.message: The transition from 'toxic Gemini behavior' to conspiracy theories could be smoother — try adding a linking sentence.
The final 'good journalist' punchline is clever — consider emphasizing it with a brief pause or tone shift before delivering.

text: You know who I think must have been the biggest gossips... you're a nosy bitch who lives for drama.

feedback.summary: Strong unique angle — clarify setup slightly for max payoff

details.message: Consider explicitly framing this as a 'historical hot take' to let the audience know you’re pivoting to absurd logic.
You could add a tag like 'Genghis Khan: gossip girl of the steppes' to escalate the absurd imagery.
